business.headline: PF claim maze unlocked: How solutions and reforms can restore faithMillions of salaried Indians rely on the Employees' Provident Fund for financial security, yet claiming it remains a maze. Experts propose steps and technological fixes to make the process smoother and hassle-free.

Pulse crisis: Why are prices crashing below MSP despite high demand?Despite this rising import bill, instead of expansion, the area under pulses cultivation has shrunk. Over the past four years, the area under pulses has declined by nearly 3.1 million hectares.

Sensex, Nifty gain for 4th straight session as investors expect strong Q2 earningsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136.63 points to close at 81,926.75, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 30.65 points higher at 25,108.30. Broader market indices also ended the session largely positive, supported by easing volatility and sustained optimism around the upcoming quarterly earnings season.

WeWork India IPO hit by InGovern's concerns over finances days before listingInGovern pointed out that the company has reported negative cash flows for several financial years, suggesting that its operations have yet to generate consistent income.

Not getting benefit of lower prices under GST 2.0? Here's what to doA recent LocalCircles survey that received over 78,000 responses from more than 27,000 people across 332 districts suggested that the benefits of GST 2.0 are reaching consumers unevenly.

World Bank sees India growth at 6.5% for FY26, 6.3% for FY27In its latest South Asia Development Update, the World Bank highlighted that South Asia's overall growth is expected to slow to 5.8% in 2026, down from 6.6% in 2025, with trade disruptions and emerging technologies, including Artificial Intelligence (AI), creating fresh uncertainties for the region.

Why the 50-30-20 budget rule doesn't work for everyone, explains expertThe popular 50-30-20 budgeting rule has guided millions of people for decades. But personal finance expert says it often overlooks individual goals and may leave you short of what you actually need.
Here's how much salary hike employees can expect in 2026According to Aon's Annual Salary Increase and Turnover Survey 2025-26 for India, employees can expect an average salary hike of 9% next year.

New airport drives up real estate prices in Navi MumbaiThe development has already pushed property prices in surrounding areas such as Panvel, Ulwe, and Kharghar, as investors and developers rush to capitalise on the opportunities the airport promises.

UPI to introduce facial and fingerprint authentication soon: ReportUPI is set to allow users to authenticate transactions using facial recognition and fingerprints, according to sources. This new feature is expected to go live soon.

Pension hike after 11 years? All-important EPFO meeting to decide soonAfter more than a decade, pensioners may finally get some relief. The EPFO is set to discuss raising the minimum pension under EPS-95 during its upcoming board meeting in Bengaluru on October 10–11.

LG Electronics IPO: GMP hints at strong listing, but is it really a good bet?Early signals from the market suggest strong demand. The Grey Market Premium, for instance, is reported at Rs 318, implying a potential listing price of around Rs 1,458 per share, roughly 28% above the upper end of the price band.
Gold prices hit another record high: Invest now or wait?With gold hitting new all-time highs, investors are asking: should I buy now, or wait for prices to stabilise?

Out of stock: How GST rate cuts have left companies scrambling for supplyLarge-screen televisions and premium mobile phones have gone out of stock in many parts of the country as manufacturers misjudged the post-GST demand surge.
Tata Capital IPO Day 2: Check GMP, subscription status and moreThe Tata Capital IPO is set to close on Wednesday, October 8, with allotment scheduled for October 9 and listing on October 13.

ITR processed but tax refund still pending? Here's what you should doMany taxpayers are finding themselves in a fix this year; their Income Tax Returns (ITRs) show "processed", but the refund hasn't reached their bank accounts yet. If you're one of them, here's what might be causing the delay and what you can do about it.

Is the auto sector rally over for now? Analysts bet on these sectors nextThe latest report from the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) shows historic sales during Navratri, backed by strong demand and the recent GST rationalisation. However, analysts believe that while the short-term growth looks impressive, the auto rally may soon stabilise as pent-up demand fades.

Sensex jumps 400 points: 3 factors behind today's rally on Dalal StreetMarket analysts pointed to a combination of factors driving the rally—upbeat Q2 updates from large-cap firms, an early pick-up in festive season spending, and improved GST collections reflecting resilient consumption.
Sensex opens 140 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Power Grid up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 215.94 points to 82,006.06, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 64.90 points to 25,142.55, as of 9:38 am.

LG Electronics IPO opens today: Check GMP, price band, and should you subscribe?The company has set a price band of Rs 1,080–Rs 1,140 per share for the offer, which comprises an offer for sale (OFS) worth Rs 11,600 crore, representing a 15% stake divestment by the South Korean parent, LG Electronics Inc.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 episode 45: Neelam refuses to cook after Gaurav's nomination jibe The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw Neelam Giri refusing to cook after Gaurav Khanna took a jibe at her during the nomination task. Tanya Mittal also had an emotional breakdown after Malti Chahar threw her into the pool.

Adivi Sesh's Dacoit may miss Christmas release after actor suffers leg injury Actor Adivi Sesh suffered a leg injury while performing an intense chase sequence in Hyderabad last week. As a result, his highly anticipated film 'Dacoit' could face a delay in release.

Priyanka, Mahesh Babu in talks for dance number in Rajamouli's Globe Trotter Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's highly anticipated film, 'Globe Trotter', could have a special dance number featuring actors Priyanka Chopra and Mahesh Babu. The makers have been brainstorming a celebratory track.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 in trouble, set sealed over environmental breach The set of 'Bigg Boss Kannada Season 12' has been sealed over environmental violations. The contestants of the reality show are expected to walk out of the premises soon.

Delhi Chief minister Rekha Gupta praises Kantara, meets Rishab Shetty Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta recently met actor Rishab Shetty and the team of 'Kantara Chapter 1' in New Delhi. She shared photos of their meeting on social media and praised the film for celebrating the country's spiritual and cultural traditions.

Ranveer-Deepika's new Abu Dhabi ad celebrates travel, love, and self-discovery Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone reunited for a stunning new campaign that captures the charm of Abu Dhabi. Blending romance with culture, the duo explored the emirate's iconic landmarks, turning their journey into a celebration of travel, love, and self-discovery.

Telugu web series D/o Prasad Rao: Kanabadutaledu to premiere on OTT in October Directed by Poluru Krishna, 'D/o Prasad Rao: Kanabadutaledu' starring Rajeev Kanakala, Udaya Bhanu, and Vasanthika, is set to start streaming on OTT from the end of October.

Black Phone 2: Ethan Hawke returns as the Ghost Grabber in a chilling new chapter 'The Black Phone 2', hitting theatres on October 17, brings Ethan Hawke back as the menacing Ghost Grabber. The sequel dives into Finn and Gwen's struggle to escape the lingering horrors of their past, blending psychological tension with chilling supernatural terror.

Thamma: Nora Fatehi stuns in retro themed spooky dance track Dilbar Ki Aankhon Ka Actor Nora Fatehi features in the new dance track 'Dilbar Ki Aankhon Ka' in 'Thamma'. She had earlier appeared in the song in the horror-comedy 'Stree' (2018).

BTS V wins over fans at Paris Fashion Week with sweet Uma Thurman moment BTS member V attends Celine Paris Fashion Week, attracting significant attention. A brief gesture towards actor Uma Thurman becomes widely shared online.

Mahayoddha Rama trailer: Ramayana gets a grand animated makeover for Diwali The animated film 'Mahayoddha Rama' offers a modern retelling of the Ramayana, blending traditional mythology with cutting-edge animation. It will release in theatres on October 17.

Exclusive: Navya Naveli on legacy, purpose and empowering Indian women with tech Navya Naveli Nanda empowers women in Haryana with AI skills. In an exclusive interview with us, she talks about combining her family's legacy with impact to build India's new future.

Ananya Panday shares frame with Pedro Pascal, Jennie at Paris Fashion Week gala Actor Ananya Panday made her Paris Fashion Week debut in style as she attended the BoF 500 Gala, meeting global stars like Pedro Pascal and Blackpink's Jennie. Her star-studded evening and stunning all-black look have set social media abuzz.

Manoj Manchu on Mirai, MMA training and dream role as Duryodhana Actor Manoj Manchu, who was recently seen in 'Mirai', exclusively spoke to IndiaToday.in about his working experience with Teja Sajja, his favourite Bollywood villain, dream role and more.

Santosh: After facing censorship issues Shahana Goswami's film to release on OTT Santosh, directed by Sandhya Suri and starring Shahana Goswami and Sunita Rajwar, will make its Indian digital debut on October 17 on Lionsgate Play. The film, which addresses caste and gender dynamics, will be accessible for the first time to Indian audiences.

Bigg Boss 19: Malti Chahar pushes Tanya Mittal into pool, objects to her crying A new 'Bigg Boss 19' promo shows Malti Chahar, the new wildcard entrant, nominating Tanya Mittal by pushing her into the pool. She was later also seen questioning her emotional reaction to the incident.

Zubeen Garg gets tribute at Karachi concert as Pak band performs Ya Ali on stage Pakistani rock band Khudgharz performed Zubeen Garg's hit song 'Ya Ali' at a Karachi concert as a tribute to the late singer. The heartfelt performance highlighted Garg's influence across borders.

George Clooney suggests incentives over President Donald Trump's tariffs on movies Actor George Clooney criticised US President Donald Trump's 100% tariff decision on overseas films as misguided. He urged federal tax incentives to support the US film industry and retain jobs.

Has Kunickaa Sadanand turned Bigg Boss 19 on its head with her narrative game? Kunickaa Sadanand delivered a reality TV masterclass on 'Bigg Boss 19', turning a minor spat into a full-blown house debate. Even after the host Salman Khan's sharp rebuke, her calm composure cemented her as one of the game's most formidable players.

general news.headline: 15 dead after landslide hits bus in Himachal's Bilaspur, rescue ops underwaySpeaking to India Today TV, Bilaspur Deputy Commissioner Rahul Kumar confirmed that 15 people have died and three have been rescued alive. There were over 30 people onboard the bus, though the exact figure is not known at this point.

Canadian PM Carney credits Trump for bringing peace between India, PakistanMark Carney praised Donald Trump for bringing peace between India and Pakistan, calling him a transformative president. The remarks mark a shift in Canada's stance following tensions over Trump's tariff threats and his annexation comments.

Indian man fighting for Russian military surrenders to Ukrainian forcesA 22-year-old Indian from Gujarat has reportedly surrendered to Ukrainian forces after fighting for Russia. He claims he joined to avoid a prison sentence.

How PK factor triggered AAP to put hat in Bihar election ringTo protect AAP's organisational structure in Bihar, the Arvind Kejriwal-led party released the first list of candidates. Party insiders said the 'PK factor' was behind the decision. Know what is it.

Why motel business is getting Gujaratis killed in USThree Gujarati people linked to the motel business were killed last week in Pennsylvania and North Carolina in two separate incidents. In all, seven Gujarat-origin people have been killed in motel crimes across the US this year. Gujaratis own 60% of the motel business in the US. Why is the motel business so risky, and how are Gujaratis coming in harm's way?

AI an existential threat to the very creation of credible news: Aroon PurieIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie warned that AI poses an existential threat to the creation of credible news, as it can replicate and monetise journalism without accountability. Speaking at FICCI Frames 2025, he said AI's rise, coupled with billionaire-owned media and algorithm-driven platforms, is eroding trust and the economic foundation of independent journalism.

Who is Richard Florez, Texas man who shot dead Indian student at US gas station?Richard Florez, 23, from North Richland Hills, Texas, was arrested for fatally shooting Indian student Chandrashekar Pole at a Fort Worth gas station before going on a violent, unprovoked rampage.

Top Haryana cop shoots himself dead at home, note mentions job-related issuesHaryana Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) Y Puran Kumar shot himself dead at his residence in Chandigarh. A 'will' and a suicide note were found, in which the victim flagged job-related issues and was facing dissatisfaction.

One-third of Silicon Valley is Indian. That's not a flex, it's an escapeBragging that one-third of Silicon Valley tech workers are Indian is no longer impressive. With record placement failures at IITs and a decaying syllabus, it's time we stopped hiding behind diaspora success. Here are six reasons why we strongly believe so.

Trouble in Opposition bloc as Congress hedges on Tejashwi Yadav as CM faceWith the Bihar polls weeks away, uncertainty remains over Mahagathbandhan's Chief Minister face, as Congress leader Udit Raj said the INDIA bloc hasn't made a collective decision.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 in trouble, set sealed over environmental breachThe set of 'Bigg Boss Kannada Season 12' has been sealed over environmental violations. The contestants of the reality show are expected to walk out of the premises soon.

Video shows final moments when Gujarati motel manager in US was shot deadA video footage has emerged of the moment when Rakesh Ehagaban-Patel, a 51-year-old Gujarati-origin motel manager, was fatally shot at point-blank range in Pittsburgh, US. Patel came to the spot after hearing gunshots and asked the shooter, Stanley Eugene West, if he was alright. West, who had shot a woman just moments ago, fired at Patel, killing him.

Is Rishab's Kantara Chapter 1 still a Rs 1,000 crore contender? Experts weigh inAhead of its release on October 2, Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' was considered as the last Rs 1,000 crore hope for Indian cinema in 2025. With Rs 300 crore in its bag and positive word-of-mouth, trade experts discuss if the film will reach the magic mark.

Dhravya Shah leaves IIT prep to launch AI startup, raises $3 million19-year-old Mumbai-born Dhravya Shah has turned heads in Silicon Valley after his AI startup, Supermemory, secured $3 million in seed funding from Google executives.

3 more children die due to 'killer' cough syrup, toll rises to 19 in Madhya PradeshThe deaths are linked to the consumption of Coldrif, a cough syrup whose samples were found to contain toxic substances.

House of judge who ruled against Trump admin gutted in fire, arson suspectedThe $1.5-million beach house of South Carolina judge Diane Goodstein was gutted in a suspected arson fire over the weekend. Goodstein had just weeks ago ruled against the administration of US President Donald Trump in a voter data case. Her husband suffered multiple fractures as he jumped from the first floor to escape the blaze. The judge was away at the time the fire broke out.

Caught on CCTV: Speeding SUV collides with 3 bikes, drags one on bonnet for 1 KmCCTV footage from a tollbooth on the Vellore-Chennai highway shows the SUV dragging a motorcycle that was stuck on its front bumper.

Bihar woman travelling without ticket argues with TTE, claims she was 'harassed'A woman travelling without a ticket in an AC coach argued with a ticket checker after being asked to leave, accusing him of "disturbing" her. A video of the same has gone viral on the internet.
The new age of travel is hereChoosing authenticity and experience over destination and bucket list, new age travellers are rewriting the geography of wanderlust.

Is Chirag Paswan inching towards an alliance with Prashant Kishor?With the NDA yet to reach a seat-sharing agreement in Bihar, sources said that the LJP (RV), led by Union Minister Chirag Paswan, could align with Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj, if its demand of 40 seats weren't met. Sources also said that Chirag himself could contest from Bihar's Shahbad region.

Mohanlal meets Army Chief in Delhi, receives commendation for Dadasaheb Phalke winActor Mohanlal met with the Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi in Delhi and received a commendation. The actor shared his appreciation for the Army and discussed ways to enhance the Territorial Army battalion.

Gunfight erupts in J&K's Rajouri, 4 terrorists likely trappedFour terrorists are believed to be trapped during a gunbattle with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district. The gunfight was triggered after terrorists fired upon a team of Jammu and Kashmir Police's Special Operations Group (SOG).

Dealulu: Trump's Gaza plan is a suicide note disguised as a peace accordHamas, the only Palestinian party to the deal has to erase itself. The other, the Palestinian Authority, has to reform itself while Israel will decide when the IDF will vacate Gaza. In the grand tradition of diplomatic doodles, this is less a treaty and more a suicide pact wrapped in gold leaf. It is not ordained to fail, it's pure-ordained to fail.

England survive Bangladesh scare as Heather Knight steers home in tricky chaseEngland registered their second successive win of the Women's World Cup 2025, defeating Bangladesh by four wickets. Heather Knight took her team over the line with an unbeaten innings of 79* (111) after surviving three close calls.

sports.headline: WFI suspends Aman Sehrawat for missing weight for World Championships The Wrestling Federation of India has suspended Aman Sehrawat for one year after he failed to make weight at the Senior World Championships. This suspension highlights concerns over discipline and professionalism within Indian wrestling's top ranks.

Brian Lara urges West Indies to revive the spirit to play Test cricket: Find a way Brian Lara has urged West Indies cricketers to bring back passion and pride for Test cricket. He stressed that attitude and dedication are more crucial than facilities for the game's revival.

Really enjoy Fatima Sana's passion and energy on the field: Ellyse Perry Star Australia all-rounder Ellyse Perry showered praise on Pakistan captain Fatima Sana ahead of their third fixture of the Women's World Cup 2025 in Colombo. She also praised her leadership skills, calling her a perfect team person.

Relentless commitment, contagious attitude: Williamson on what makes Siraj special Kane Williamson has praised Mohammed Siraj for his leadership and team-first approach. His rise from IPL talent to a key India bowler highlights his growing influence in cricket.

Sanju Samson named CEAT T20I batter of the year, dedicates award to wife Charu Sanju Samson won the CEAT men's T20I batter of the year award after a remarkable run as an opener in the past 12 months. He slammed three centuries in 12 innings after being promoted to open the innings.

Watch: Mohun Bagan players confronted by fans for refusing to travel to Iran for ACL2 Mohun Bagan players refused to travel to Iran for the AFC Champions League 2 fixture against Sepahan FC. This decision sparked fan confrontations and highlighted safety concerns due to international travel advisories.

England survive Bangladesh scare as Heather Knight steers home in tricky chase England registered their second successive win of the Women's World Cup 2025, defeating Bangladesh by four wickets. Heather Knight took her team over the line with an unbeaten innings of 79* (111) after surviving three close calls.

Gautam Gambhir instils Spartan mentality in Team India: Varun Chakravarthy Varun Chakravarthy lauded head coach Gautam Gambhir for bringing a Spartan mentality to Team India, saying there is no room for mediocrity. He emphasised that Gambhir's approach pushes players to give their absolute best in every game.

Pakistan's Sidra Amin aims to take responsibility in leading the charge vs Australia Pakistan's Sidra Amin is ready to lead from the front against Australia, embracing her role as the team's "backbone." Focused on patience and responsibility, she aims to anchor Pakistan's innings and turn belief into performance in Colombo.

Pakistan's bowlers could give us the edge to take down Australia: Sidra Amin Pakistan's Sidra Amin believes that their bowling unit could give them an edge as they gear up to face the defending champions, Australia in the group-stages of the Women's World Cup.

Wuhan Open: Emma Raducanu forced to retire after medical time-out as heat takes toll Emma Raducanu retired from her first-round match at the Wuhan Open due to heat exhaustion. The extreme weather conditions continue to affect players and impact tournament outcomes.

England survive Bangladesh scare as Heather Knight steers home in tricky chase England registered their second successive win of the Women's World Cup 2025, defeating Bangladesh by four wickets. Heather Knight took her team over the line with an unbeaten innings of 79* (111) after surviving three close calls.

Gautam Gambhir instils Spartan mentality in Team India: Varun Chakravarthy Varun Chakravarthy lauded head coach Gautam Gambhir for bringing a Spartan mentality to Team India, saying there is no room for mediocrity. He emphasised that Gambhir's approach pushes players to give their absolute best in every game.

Focused on patience and responsibility, she aims to anchor Pakistan's innings and turn belief into performance in Colombo.

Pakistan's bowlers could give us the edge to take down Australia: Sidra Amin Pakistan's Sidra Amin believes that their bowling unit could give them an edge as they gear up to face the defending champions, Australia in the group-stages of the Women's World Cup.

Wuhan Open: Emma Raducanu forced to retire after medical time-out as heat takes toll Emma Raducanu retired from her first-round match at the Wuhan Open due to heat exhaustion. The extreme weather conditions continue to affect players and impact tournament outcomes.

Australia focused on playing positively on Colombo's slow track: Ellyse PerryAustralia all-rounder Ellyse Perry says the team will bat positively on Colombo's slow pitch against Pakistan. Australia will take on Pakistan in their third fixture of the Women's World Cup 2025 after having their second match washed out.

Hyderabad FC now Sporting Club Delhi: Everything to know about ISL's capital returnDelhi is finally back on India's top-tier football map as Hyderabad FC relocates and rebrands as Sporting Club Delhi. The capital gets its first permanent ISL club in over five years, aiming to revive a forgotten footballing legacy.

Mohammed Siraj credits MS Dhoni's wisdom for helping him rise above criticismMohammed Siraj has revealed how MS Dhoni's advice helped him to withstand hostile online attacks during his challenging early years in the IPL. Siraj rose to the limelight after being bought for Rs 2.2 Crore by the Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Olympic hopes, a tragic crash, and redemption: Tazmin Brits' road to World Cup dreamTazmin Brits overcame a life-threatening car accident to emerge as a top South African cricketer. Her inspiring journey highlights resilience and aims to raise road safety awareness.

Rodrygo opens up on personally tough 2024-25 season at Real Madrid: Ancelotti helpedAfter a turbulent end to last season, Real Madrid's Rodrygo Goes opened up about his personal struggles. He revealed how Carlo Ancelotti played a vital role in helping him regain balance, motivation, and confidence.

Watch: Prithvi Shaw flings his bat at ex-Mumbai teammates in heated exchangePrithvi Shaw was seen involved in a heated verbal exchange following his dismissal when playing against his former team, Mumbai in the warm-up clash.

MS Dhoni earns his wings: Former India captain becomes certified drone pilotMS Dhoni has added drone piloting to his list of passions, earning a DGCA-certified drone pilot license. He completed his training at Garuda Aerospace's DGCA-approved center in Chennai.

No guarantee that Kohli and Rohit will play World Cup 2027: AB de VilliersLegendary South Africa batter AB de Villiers has expressed doubts over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's participation in the ODI World Cup 2027. The duo is set to return to the 50-over format in the upcoming ODI series against Australia.

Rodrygo opens up on personally tough 2024-25 season at Real Madrid: Ancelotti helpedAfter a turbulent end to last season, Real Madrid's Rodrygo Goes opened up about his personal struggles. He revealed how Carlo Ancelotti played a vital role in helping him regain balance, motivation, and confidence.

Watch: Prithvi Shaw flings his bat at ex-Mumbai teammates in heated exchangePrithvi Shaw was seen involved in a heated verbal exchange following his dismissal when playing against his former team, Mumbai in the warm-up clash.

MS Dhoni earns his wings: Former India captain becomes certified drone pilotMS Dhoni has added drone piloting to his list of passions, earning a DGCA-certified drone pilot license. He completed his training at Garuda Aerospace's DGCA-approved center in Chennai.

No guarantee that Kohli and Rohit will play World Cup 2027: AB de VilliersLegendary South Africa batter AB de Villiers has expressed doubts over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's participation in the ODI World Cup 2027. The duo is set to return to the 50-over format in the upcoming ODI series against Australia.

PAK rolls out free, super-cheap tickets for SA Tests to tackle poor crowdsPakistan Cricket Board has rolled out free and super-affordable tickets for their upcoming two-Test series against South Africa, hoping to revive fan interest. The move comes amid a worrying trend of low turnouts for Test cricket across Asia, including India.

Prithvi Shaw hits daddy hundred vs former team Mumbai before Ranji comebackOut-of-favour India batter made a statement on Tuesday, hitting a daddy hundred for Maharashtra against Mumbai, his former team, in a warm-up match in Pune ahead of the upcoming Ranji Trophy season.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi needs to be fast-tracked like Sachin: Ex-cricketerRajasthan Royals' director of cricket Zubin Barucha wants Vaibhav Suryavanshi to be fast-tracked to the Indian team. The 14-year-old has been dominating age-group cricket around the world.

Ajith Kumar brings speed and style to Spain, wins Anand Mahindra's praiseAjith Kumar's high-speed test of the Mahindra Formula E car in Spain has won admiration from Anand Mahindra, highlighting the actor's growing passion for motorsports. Balancing a film career with competitive racing, Ajith is now gearing up for more exciting races, including the Asian Le Mans in December.

Fabio Cannavaro named Uzbekistan coach for 2026 World Cup debutItalian World Cup-winning captain Fabio Cannavaro has been appointed as Uzbekistan's national football team head coach, guiding the Central Asian nation into their first-ever FIFA World Cup appearance in 2026. The move signals Uzbekistan's ambition to make a mark on the world stage, bolstered by key players and a globally experienced coaching staff.

Brooke Halliday gutted after NZ's loss to SA: We let Sophie Devine downBrooke Halliday admitted that New Zealand's heavy defeat to South Africa in the Women's World Cup 2025 was especially disappointing as the team failed to support their skipper Sophie Devine. It was only Devine who stood her ground against the Proteas, depsite being in a losing cause.

India's fastest meets the world's fastest: Kujur hangs out with Usain BoltIndia's fastest man Animesh Kujur met his hero Usain Bolt in Mumbai. The duo met through a Puma collaboration after Animesh's breakthrough season in Indian athletics.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
